page.title: 03 Great Trill
page.content: Great Trill used to be a manor but it is now a farm. It used to belong to the Drakes, who had a coat of arms at the side of the house carved in stone. The manor had lots of blocked doors and windows. There were lots of small barn doors and windows. Round the door were arches. There was a door with steps leading to it. The steps were crumbled but you could still see them. John Drake moved into Great Trill because Ashe House, his family house, was burnt down in the civil war. John Drake was born on the 31st of May in 1660 at Trill. The First Duke of Marlborough was born at Trill. A few fields away there was a battle. So many men were killed all the blood went into the stream. The stream is called Budley Lake. The battle took place at War Lake.
